properties.name: management.server.tomcat.accesslog.prefix
properties.description: Management log file name prefix.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accept-count
properties.description: Maximum queue length for incoming connection requests when all possible request processing threads are in use.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accesslog.buffered
properties.description: Whether to buffer output such that it is flushed only periodically.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accesslog.check-exists
properties.description: Whether to check for log file existence so it can be recreated if an external process has renamed it.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accesslog.condition-if
properties.description: Whether logging of the request will only be enabled if "ServletRequest.getAttribute(conditionIf)" does not yield null.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accesslog.condition-unless
properties.description: Whether logging of the request will only be enabled if "ServletRequest.getAttribute(conditionUnless)" yield null.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accesslog.directory
properties.description: Directory in which log files are created. Can be absolute or relative to the Tomcat base dir.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accesslog.enabled
properties.description: Enable access log.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accesslog.encoding
properties.description: Character set used by the log file. Default to the system default character set.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accesslog.file-date-format
properties.description: Date format to place in the log file name.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accesslog.ipv6-canonical
properties.description: Whether to use IPv6 canonical representation format as defined by RFC 5952.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accesslog.locale
properties.description: Locale used to format timestamps in log entries and in log file name suffix. Default to the default locale of the Java process.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accesslog.max-days
properties.description: Number of days to retain the access log files before they are removed.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accesslog.pattern
properties.description: Format pattern for access logs.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accesslog.prefix
properties.description: Log file name prefix.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accesslog.rename-on-rotate
properties.description: Whether to defer inclusion of the date stamp in the file name until rotate time.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accesslog.request-attributes-enabled
properties.description: Set request attributes for the IP address, Hostname, protocol, and port used for the request.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accesslog.rotate
properties.description: Whether to enable access log rotation.

properties.name: server.tomcat.accesslog.suffix
properties.description: Log file name suffix.

properties.name: server.tomcat.additional-tld-skip-patterns
properties.description: List of additional patterns that match jars to ignore for TLD scanning. The special '?' and '*' characters can be used in the pattern to match one and only one character and zero or more characters respectively.

properties.name: server.tomcat.background-processor-delay
properties.description: Delay between the invocation of backgroundProcess methods. If a duration suffix is not specified, seconds will be used.

properties.name: server.tomcat.basedir
properties.description: Tomcat base directory. If not specified, a temporary directory is used.

properties.name: server.tomcat.connection-timeout
properties.description: Amount of time the connector will wait, after accepting a connection, for the request URI line to be presented.

properties.name: server.tomcat.keep-alive-timeout
properties.description: Time to wait for another HTTP request before the connection is closed. When not set the connectionTimeout is used. When set to -1 there will be no timeout.

properties.name: server.tomcat.max-connections
properties.description: Maximum number of connections that the server accepts and processes at any given time. Once the limit has been reached, the operating system may still accept connections based on the "acceptCount" property.

properties.name: server.tomcat.max-http-form-post-size
properties.description: Maximum size of the form content in any HTTP post request.

properties.name: server.tomcat.max-http-response-header-size
properties.description: Maximum size of the HTTP response header.

properties.name: server.tomcat.max-keep-alive-requests
properties.description: Maximum number of HTTP requests that can be pipelined before the connection is closed. When set to 0 or 1, keep-alive and pipelining are disabled. When set to -1, an unlimited number of pipelined or keep-alive requests are allowed.

properties.name: server.tomcat.max-parameter-count
properties.description: Maximum number of parameters (GET plus POST) that will be automatically parsed by the container. A value of less than 0 means no limit.

properties.name: server.tomcat.max-part-count
properties.description: Maximum total number of parts permitted in a multipart/form-data request. Requests that exceed this limit will be rejected. A value of less than 0 means no limit.

properties.name: server.tomcat.max-part-header-size
properties.description: Maximum per-part header size permitted in a multipart/form-data request. Requests that exceed this limit will be rejected. A value of less than 0 means no limit.

properties.name: server.tomcat.max-swallow-size
properties.description: Maximum amount of request body to swallow.

properties.name: server.tomcat.mbeanregistry.enabled
properties.description: Whether Tomcat's MBean Registry should be enabled.

properties.name: server.tomcat.processor-cache
properties.description: Maximum number of idle processors that will be retained in the cache and reused with a subsequent request. When set to -1 the cache will be unlimited with a theoretical maximum size equal to the maximum number of connections.

properties.name: server.tomcat.redirect-context-root
properties.description: Whether requests to the context root should be redirected by appending a / to the path. When using SSL terminated at a proxy, this property should be set to false.

properties.name: server.tomcat.relaxed-path-chars
properties.description: List of additional unencoded characters that should be allowed in URI paths. Only "< > [ \ ] ^ ` { | }" are allowed.

properties.name: server.tomcat.relaxed-query-chars
properties.description: List of additional unencoded characters that should be allowed in URI query strings. Only "< > [ \ ] ^ ` { | }" are allowed.

properties.name: server.tomcat.remoteip.host-header
properties.description: Name of the HTTP header from which the remote host is extracted.

properties.name: server.tomcat.remoteip.internal-proxies
properties.description: Internal proxies that are to be trusted. Can be set as a comma separate list of CIDR or as a regular expression.

properties.name: server.tomcat.remoteip.port-header
properties.description: Name of the HTTP header used to override the original port value.

properties.name: server.tomcat.remoteip.protocol-header
properties.description: Header that holds the incoming protocol, usually named "X-Forwarded-Proto".

properties.name: server.tomcat.remoteip.protocol-header-https-value
properties.description: Value of the protocol header indicating whether the incoming request uses SSL.

properties.name: server.tomcat.remoteip.remote-ip-header
properties.description: Name of the HTTP header from which the remote IP is extracted. For instance, 'X-FORWARDED-FOR'.

properties.name: server.tomcat.remoteip.trusted-proxies
properties.description: Regular expression defining proxies that are trusted when they appear in the "remote-ip-header" header.

properties.name: server.tomcat.resource.allow-caching
properties.description: Whether static resource caching is permitted for this web application.

properties.name: server.tomcat.resource.cache-max-size
properties.description: Maximum size of the static resource cache.

properties.name: server.tomcat.resource.cache-ttl
properties.description: Time-to-live of the static resource cache.

properties.name: server.tomcat.threads.max
properties.description: Maximum amount of worker threads. Doesn't have an effect if virtual threads are enabled.

properties.name: server.tomcat.threads.max-queue-capacity
properties.description: Maximum capacity of the thread pool's backing queue. This setting only has an effect if the value is greater than 0.

properties.name: server.tomcat.threads.min-spare
properties.description: Minimum amount of worker threads. Doesn't have an effect if virtual threads are enabled.

properties.name: server.tomcat.uri-encoding
properties.description: Character encoding to use to decode the URI.

properties.name: server.tomcat.use-apr
properties.description: Whether to use APR.

properties.name: server.tomcat.use-relative-redirects
properties.description: Whether HTTP 1.1 and later location headers generated by a call to sendRedirect will use relative or absolute redirects.
